com.salesforce.androidsdk.smartstore.store

Class SqliteLibraryLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.androidsdk.smartstore.store.SqliteLibraryLoader

  • public class SqliteLibraryLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    When loading sqlite library we see UnsatisfiedLinkError exceptions This stack overflow post (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/18111739/why-do-some-android-phones-cause-our-app-to-throw-an-java-lang-unsatisfiedlinker) suggests the problem is with unzipping the apk, and manually doing it. Since we don't want to modify sql cipher's code, we will have to duplicate SQLiteDatabase.loadLibs code in this class. This class will handle loading sql cipher for us. If we get an unsatisfied error, we will unzip the application apk, extract the so files to the application's data directory, and call System.load() from the application directory
